name: The Common
address: first floor, 9406 3rd Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11209, USA

reviews.text: Food is amazingly good ğŸ‘ place was crowded by 9 a.m.
Nice, nice, nice!...
Amazing spot. Truly underrated
Wonderful unique breakfast selection, great and friendly service

Most underrated and unique restaurant Iâ€™ve ever been too.   Amazing brunches with delicious French toast.  Lunch sandwiches are delicious.  Spicy and flavorful.  Quiet spot.  Great service.  Reasonable prices. Me and wifey love this spot !!

Wonderful small and comfy place to get breakfast brunch and lunch. Their food was delicious and each item on the menu touches on a different take on different cultural foods. Their cucumber water and mango mint tea were very refreshing and had no added sugar so they tasted the way the drink is mean to taste. I had the pickles in a jar (home made), dumpling stir fry and tres leches cake. All were delicious and very well made. I wpuld highly recommend it. The staff was very friendly, patient and amazing. I would highly recommend this place to anyone in the area looking for some good food.

The food is absolutely delicious! The service was wonderful and the atmosphere is cheery and upbeat. Chef Aleksandr was amazing, engaging, and a master at his craft. The entire experience was excellent.  We loved it!
Perfect brunch spot! Excellent food and friendly service.
Heard this place was really good and had to check it out! Friendly atmosphere, great service and yummy food! What more can you ask for! Loved my breakfast ratatouille! Will def come back!
Solid hearty meals here, friendly staff, clean operation. Under the radar Bay Ridge eatery.

Well, well, wellâ€¦ La. Dee. Dah. Color me impressed. Me and my absolutely blazing hot companion of the fairer formature took a chance on one of the most bopping eateries in Bay Ridge. And well, well, well. Where. To. Start. I showed my lady to her seat, body? 10. Face? 10. Personality? 10. Eitherwho, upon relieving my legs, a.k.a. sitting, I was pleased to see two glasses of water for me and my lady. I was even more pleased that upon the drinkalage of this beverage I realized it had been infused with cucumber. I was immediately refreshed, energized, eagerly in wait for what I could feel was something bedazzling. Coffee? 10. Entrees? 10. Perfectly seasoned. Perfectly portioned. Yes indeed. Yes indeed. But what I could not have expected was that upon the simmering seÃ±oritaâ€™s request for a baked specialty, it was brought to us almost immediately after we finished our entrees, of course. I was already satisfied, but be trusting, the most cunning and cletaverous cadaver could not say no to a face like that. Anywho, dessert. Yes. Life altering. Incredible. Furthest thing from inedible. I would like to thank the Common for an absolute bedazzler of a breakfast outing. Go here folks, donâ€™t let these inferior restaurants act as your shepherd. No. No. No. Go to the Common. Yesâ€¦ yesâ€¦ yesâ€¦
Delicious food and friendly staff

If they had endless mimosas /any adult beverages for brunch this place would be lit.

Delicious food with substitution options available

Friendly/helpful staff

This place shows that atmosphere matters in restaurants. The vibe is distinctive, the staff is personable, and it seems like a secret world within familiar surroundings. The team demonstrates remarkable customer assistance and clearly appreciates their merchandise. Both what I ate and how I was treated exceeded expectations. I'm excited about my next visit to taste different options.
One of the best places in Brooklyn for breakfast! Ive came here several times. Its a smaller space so expect a wait depending on the time, but its well worth it
I love this place. Potato tart is my favourite.
5 stars all around. Ambiance, service, menu, flavors. 5 out of 5.

The Common totally deserves all of their positive reviews. Personal favorite dishes are Crispy Potato Tart and Croast. The friendly staff really add to the positivity of the experience. For sure among the best Bay Ridge restaurants, if not the best.
Wonderful breakfast and place! Easy going atmosphere, with great food.

What a delight it was coming in for breakfast the other day. From the selection to the atmosphere to the flavor and taste. We each started with the homemade mango iced tea, and pickle cup...

Then I had the homemade poached egg skillet that tasted and very similar to shashuka with perfectly poached eggs and fresh mozzarella and side of pita. And my girlfriend had the avocado naan with eggs, side of breakfast sausage that was similar to a kielbasa flavor profile wise. We like it so much we might go back tomorrow for a second time in 3 days.

But highly recommend anyone in the area looking for somewhere to eat breakfast or lunch. Was a pleasant surprise.

Delicious breakfast food!!! Stopped in around 10am and we got seated quickly. It's a small place but it didn't feel too crowded. We got started with water and two mango iced teas. It wasn't sweet at all which we enjoyed.

We ordered the Breakfast Naan with a side of grilled sausage and one of the skillets with sweet chili sauce. Both phenomenal! We dogged everything down in like 5 minutes. Left no crumbs. Everything on menu looked so good too. We are definitely coming back!!
Great mushroom radish and avocado w sunny side up egg over quinoa bowl!
Iâ€™m a fan of their wide selection of coffees and bagels! Those two things alone are what keep me coming back!

On weekends during the school year, we come here at least once because my kids love it. Itâ€™s a quaint, family-friendly breakfast restaurant with good staff and even better food. Also, we know the owner a bit now, and heâ€™s a great guy.
My wife and I visit this restaurant often with our toddler and we are always treated well and the food is always delicious. Highly recommended!!
I like the menuâ€¦a good mix of classics and unique breakfast dishes. And itâ€™s nice that the menu isnâ€™t a short novel. I hate places that do that!!
Even on days when theyâ€™re busy (and it takes longer to get the food), the waiters and waitresses are always friendly and apologetic, and thatâ€™s all I can ask for. Happy to recommend!

Iâ€™ve had a couple of first dates here over the years. I think itâ€™s the perfect venue for themâ€”good atmosphere and good food. Also, this is one of the only places in the area that consistently makes a good cappuccino, which is important to me. In addition to the max star rating, I also feel two thumbs up are deserved.

Great first visit! Loved the atmosphere and attentive waiter. The food was amazing, though seeing chefs making the food without gloves was a bit concerning which made me not give a 5 star. Overall, a top-notch spot!
Chef Alex is my guy! When I see him walking around chatting with patrons, I know the meal is going to be S-tier. Iâ€™m always willing and eager to support small businesses like Common Cafe.
I can count on the staff at Common Cafe to deliver prompt service each and every time. And, of course, the food is sensational!

I love the Common Cafe! In fact, itâ€™s become my go-to breakfast spot. I used to go to another one thatâ€™s close by, but the Common Cafe is definitely better in all the ways that matter to me. I hope this doesnâ€™t change, but Iâ€™m confident it wonâ€™t. Consider this five-star review a ringing endorsement.

This is the kind of hipster diner that your 85-year-old mother will like too: "Everything tasty and fresh too!" It's hard to put into words what the common gets so very right.  For starters, there's nothing common about the menu. It's sorta gourmet without the fuss, hip without the funk, eclectic without the confusion of fusion.  I took pictures of the menu to post because it will speak for itself, if you'll take it from me that it delivers on its promise. Service is casual, but attentive.  Ambience is a cross between rustic and industrial.  It's coolness is muted, so comfortable.  Maybe almost too muted--you might walk right past it at the corner of third avenue and 94th Street, down from the Walgreens.  Don't do that. Go in. But it's been discovered, so count on a wait.
But worth the wait.
Food is unique and scrumptious
Great brunch spot only downside there's no alcohol in the location so no mimosas!

Great food & friendly staff.
This became our go-to breakfast place for our entire stay.
Very cute place with amazing food and very friendly stuff. My favourite breakfast spot in the area not only because of the taste but also the big variety of choices.

It's Easter Sunday an we were brain storming for places that may or may not be open on this holy holiday.  We wanted to go to The Common, but were they open?  Eh... So we got dressed and took a walk to the restaurant and low and behold, the restaurant was open!

Stuffed with people, The Common was moving and jiving as always. Luckily, they had a small table in the back, so we took a seat, and peered over the menus. We decided what we wanted, just at the same time someone swooped over to deliver our water, our starter drinks, take our orders and get everything in the works.

No more than 10 minutes later...

Picturesque plates of scrumptious food were delivered to our table, with customizations on-point; Everything perfect.  The Fresh Toast Sammich - My Man consumed that faster than a shredder machine gets through a tax return.  Seriously.  It was perfect.   My Ratatouille was drop-your-fork-roll-your-head-back-in-amazement divine.   It was so good, I was shocked that ratatouille could BE that good.  I personally make ratatouille, and mine is delicious but it isn't THAT amazing.

We finished as much as we could, because portions were hefty, took the leftovers (because leaving that would have been stupidity) and paid our bill.  Very affordable - two people for under $40.  Left a large tip, because they certainly deserve it, picked up our bag of yummies, and headed home.

We visit The Common consistently; Usually once a week.  It's a staple business in our community, and it's an incredible gem for those who are visiting from outside of Bay Ridge or for the locals who haven't been before.

This place is like really really good
The meatloaf grits 10/10
The skillet pancake 100/10
The service 100/10
Place is so cozy and beautiful
Great food!
This place is now my favorite for breakfast/brunch! Delicious, fast and sooo good. Recommend-recommend-recommend!!! ğŸ˜ğŸ˜ğŸ˜

Nice breakfast food and fresh ingredients.   Delicious tomatoes jam and mushrooms.  Service,  specially the girl was very attentive.  Took 1 star off because orange juice was Tropicana,  they should continue the great ingredients with fresh squeeze juice.
Hidden gem!
Very nice and cool place. I tried breakfast tacos and they were delicious.

The Common is our go to spot in Bay Ridge for all things breakfast and brunch. The food is so delicious, cozy and always feels like home cooking but better!
Everything is seasoned so well and cooked to perfection. The menu is diverse and has some things for everyone. Light bites or something nice and hardy.
The service is fantastic. The staff is warm and inviting and so seamless with serving. I will always recommend The Common.
The brunch was great. The staff was kind and accommodating. Highly recommend.

I frequent this establishment regularly. However, on the weekends I call to get an estimated wait time; but no one answers the phone. This is unacceptable customer service. If you're unable to handle the load like the previous manager, then they need to go somewhere else.  This place is a gem to be losing customers on simple customer service.
I was amazed by the lemon tartar! It was light and airy, with a perfect balance of sweet and sour flavors. The hint of freshness made it even more delicious. A truly delightful treat!
Can't order to go? That's a new one.
All way 5 star

We asked for some recommendations since it was our first time trying this place and the waitress who by the way was pretty kind, friendly and offered and amazing service recommended us the Croats and the chicken waffles. They were delicious  and tasty too. I will definitely come back . Just a recommendation to reserve ahead of time,since we had to wait 30 minutes to get a table  and there was no place for us to wait inside other than that such an amazing experience.
Spanish :

Pedimos algunas recomendaciones ya que era nuestra primera vez probando este lugar y la camarera que por cierto era bastante amable, simpÃ¡tica y nos ofreciÃ³ un servicio increÃ­ble nos recomendÃ³ los croatas y los waffles de pollo. Estaban deliciosos y sabrosos tambiÃ©n. Definitivamente volverÃ©. Solo una recomendaciÃ³n de realizar su reserva con anticipaciÃ³n ya que tuvimos que esperar 30 minutos para conseguir una mesa y no habÃ­a lugar para esperar adentro, aparte de eso, fue una experiencia increÃ­ble.

Truly wonderful. The food was amazing. The service was quick and friendly. I ordered the breakfast Mac and cheese because the waitress suggested it. I am so happy I did. It was one of the best things I've ever eaten!

Had THE BEST breakfast AGAIN today with my cousin at my FAVE place- The Common!  Not only is the food delicious but it's so beautifully presented. The service is great and the atmosphere is very pleasant. A great Bay Ridge breakfast & lunch place!

Loved our meal at the Common, definitely one of my new favorite brunch spots in Bay Ridge!
Had great options for brunch and lunch.  We enjoyed the waffle and chicken, sausage skillet and fish and chips.  Also ordered the prosciutto and mozzarella toast, everything came out quite quickly and it was all delicious!  I also really enjoyed the pistachio latte iced - creamy and packed with pistachio flavor.
Staff were all friendly and accommodating.
Would highly recommend and certainly will be back again!

The place gives a rustic and home vibe and I love it! The staff were really friendly and welcoming. I went twice in a week and one of the staff remembered me and was so happy to see me back. The fries are to die for!!! The menu has a great selection and I would love to try everything on the menu in the future.

The Common is one of the best brunch places in Bayridge. Ive tried all kinds of brunch dishes here and loved all of them. I always come back to the crispy potato tart. It was little too crispy today but was so good. It was cooked so well that it wasnâ€™t burnt and it held up extremely well with the egg, sour cream, and lox topped with green onions. I emptied the entire plate and drink my wide mug of cappuccino. I was in food heaven. My wife got her Eggs Benedict and i tried each bite of her plate and that was also fantastic. The potatoes were well seasoned and had a nice bite to it. Honestly you cannot go wrong here. I recommend getting there early because the place is unfortunately small and you can be waiting to be seated

Easily my favorite brunch spot in Bay Ridge. The food is delicious, portions are big and prices are reasonable. Service is fast and friendly and the restaurant is stylish. The wait time can be long at times and they donâ€™t take reservations so be sure to plan ahead especially on weekends.

Amazing brunch and lunch spot! Itâ€™s fast becoming our go to spot! Everything weâ€™ve ordered this far has been delicious. There are many more items on the menu that we want to try so we will definitely be coming back!

P.S. donâ€™t let the crazy wait time deter you. They usually tell us 45 min to 1 hour wait and then we get called within a half hour.

First time at The Common, and it was SO GOOD! Great service overall. Chicken Liver (really delicious) and Cavatelli was amazing even our toddler loved it. Had the chicken and waffles with egg, DELICIOUS. Beet salad and potato appetizers as well really good.. The atmosphere was cozy and relaxing. Also had high chairs for the kiddos. Will definitely be returning to try other plates on the menu. Very nice brunch/lunch spot for anyone!

First time here with my husband. Been wanting to try this spot for a while. We came for breakfasts but was told from the waitress we can order the lunch menu too. Why no steak and eggs in a lot of brunch spots anymore ? Smh. We had the Californian omelet and the in a skillet Lebanese five spice stew. I really enjoyed the stew. It wasnâ€™t too heavy. My hubby enjoyed the omelet and we were both full. The coffee wasnâ€™t the best but overall the atmosphere was great.

The food is so good. Their seasoning is on point, while the eggs are still running and cooked to perfection. We will have to come back and try more items on the menu. The place is usually packed on the weekend, but thereâ€™s no line on weekdays.

My favorite place to grab breakfast. Everything is so good and fresh. I love their skillet breakfast and egg benedict. Jen, our waitress was AMAZING. Super friendly and lovelyğŸ¤—

Also try their skillet pancake, it's straight from heaven.

Had the most wonderful breakfast with my fiancÃ© while visiting Bay Ridge. We had the three poached eggs with meatball stew in a skillet and the avocado breakfast burrito. Food is delicious and we had a great window seat to soak in the sun. Amazing atmosphere. Would definitely return again. ğŸ³ â¤ï¸

Had been here for brunch. It was a Sunday but we were seated pretty quickly. There was barely a wait of 10 mins max. We started off with chips and dip appetizer and mango mint iced tea. Loved the take on the chips and dip. The dip was fabulous with smoked salmon and cream fraiche. The tea was okay very watery and unsweetened. We had to ask for sugar. We then got eggs Benedict with fried chicken and skillet number 2. Loved both the dishes. The skillet had a sour and tangy soupy broth with potatoes and poached eggs served with pita. The egg Benedict was delicious as well. However the fried chicken lacked seasoning. Would have loved if it had a little more flavor to it. It came with a side of fried potatoes and arugula. The portion sizes were good and the food was very filling. Friendly service and comforting space.

My god, this place is tiny.  Max 20 seats?  Had to wait 20 minutes for seating.  Ordered enough for 8 people, just wanted to try a few dishes.  Food was good.  Waffles were soggy.  Should have asked for the toppings to be on the side.â€¦

Officially one of my new favorite spots, the food was super delicious with many unique options (so Iâ€™ll definitely be back for more) and the staff was friendly. I gave the chef a compliment on my way out and he was very courteous and thankful. Had the sausage skillet, quinoa bowl with pulled pork, and we topped it off with the skillet pancake. They donâ€™t take reservations but the wait was under 20 minutes. Highly recommend, great place ğŸ‘Œ

Dined here for the first time whilst vacationing in Brooklyn. Great, hearty food, excellent customer service and a gem of a service from Jen!
Highly recommended.
I donâ€™t know if I should start with the service the good, the chefs? They are all amazing, and will always accommodate your request. the food will always have you craving for your next visit.

I had a wonderful experience at The Common Restaurant. The breakfast I chose was delightful, especially the ratatouille which exceeded my expectations. The combination of three poached eggs and brioche toast was a perfect match. I'm already looking forward to coming back for this same delicious meal! Kudos to the chef!

My partner and I walked into milk & honey and the place looked like a crowded college library cafe. We walked right the hell out. I searched up brunch spots near me and see that The Common was conveniently right door next to it! We decided to give it a shot. I was blown the heck away!!! This is a lowkey brunch spot with BANGING food and nice welcoming people. Our dishes were very effortful and delicious. We had the skillet pancake, Croast and the Reuben toast and wow! ğŸ¤¤

Definitely worth the visit to The Common! Food was beyond my expectations, the ambiance was great, it was crowded for a Tuesday morning (I was on vacation), but got a table rather quickly. New favorite breakfast spot in Brooklyn!

The hidden gem in South Brooklyn. The chef has the most interesting and delicious creations. I always get the pistachio latte is the best Iâ€™ve had. The only catch is that you have to wait for a seat, so plan ahead, put your number down, and then wait in your car if itâ€™s cold out.

Absolutely amazing food, this was my first time here but not the last, I highly recommended. Great service, food came out quickly and I wanted more. The smoothie was great and the pear drink was delicious.

The food is always delicious here. This is the perfect little neighborhood spot for fresh and flavorful brunch. The servers are kind and patient and very knowledgeable. They always accommodate my food allergies.

Had brunch with friends and although the reviews I read, warned me of young servers, I decided to give it a try. The restaurant is small but clean and the service extremely slow. It took almost 20 minutes to get coffee. We ordered the chicken and waffles (interesting flavor with cheddar but chicken was overcooked and it was just a thigh cutlet so won't order again); Latin Breakfast and California Omelet (other dishes were enjoyed). The worse part of our experience was when I asked for water and then my friend did the same, the server took my glass and placed it in between her arm pit and breast. I would not eat here again.

i have been here about 5 times since discovering it last month. the food is so yummy and great quality!! they have a wide variety of options. all the staff are warm and attentive, and they also serve cucumber lemon water. if youâ€™re looking for a go to brunch spot pls come here.

Our food was outstanding. Def worth the travel. Portion sizes are small for the price, but the taste somewhat makes up for it. I even tried a avocado smoothie, which was so yummy!!!

We had the
The smoked salmon avocado toast (I got a side of pesto - which helped a lot!)
The Skillet Pancake
The Cheesy Grits and
Sausage.

Service was a bit delayed, but they were doing several things at once.

It feels like a homey place that you could go to with friends, def not fancy which is nice for brunch sometimes

I was a bit worried at first.  The menu is very busy and it feels like every recipe has a thousand ingredients.  I was happily surprised by how much I liked their breakfast sandwich.  Itâ€™s petite for light appetites.  All the ingredients were fresh and flavorful.  I would skip the mint tea, tastes like cinnamon.

We live in the area and finally we got the chance to taste the food at this cafe. The place is cozy and the food is delicious and healthy. The staff is very polite and welcoming. They definitely know what a customer service is. Food on time, coffee on time, need to share a plate - thatâ€™s noted too without you asking of it. Will definitely be coming back here for breakfast

The Common is FANTASTIC! The food, drinks and staff are truly amazing. My favorite drink is the pistachio latteâ€¦ perfect everytime! I have always tried different food options and have never been disappointed. I just tried the Skillet Pancake and it is now my new favorite. ğŸ™ŒğŸ» Highly recommend!

Food is delicious. Came back 2nd day in a roll.
Iâ€™m never a pancake person but man, I love the pancake!!
Service is great! Many choices to choose from!
